intro: Stemmacantha imatongensis, commonly known as the Imatong stemmacantha, is a flowering plant native to the Democratic Republic of the Congo. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its upright, branched stems and large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or red. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and the plant thrives in moist, tropical environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a landscape plant.
